page.title: 18Southern Cheam, Surrey.
page.content: The area of Cheam south of the railway lies on chalk and until the establishment of the local waterboard in l863 was waterless and therefore largely unpopulated. It formed a beautiful area of gently rolling downland and not surprisingly residential development was fairly rapid once water was available. Large late_Victorian and Edwardian detached houses stretched from the village up the slope of the Downs each one glorying in its large garden filled with trees, shrubs, Pampas grass and flower beds. Many of the gardens have since been sold and are occupied by pleasant, more modern houses. Today this is an area of expensive, detached medium to low density housing, much in demand by London's Commuter Population The residents jealously conserve the environment and wildlife of Downland.
